group_1.narration: The danger my home,@Natsume Books, faced was...
It's what's called "land sharking".@They were forcing Dad to sell the land.
And it wasn't just Natsume Books. The@whole neighborhood was being pressured.
My dad was strongly against the idea...

group_1.textRight: I want to protect this store.
I won't sell, no matter what.
Just don't tell them that I'm a bit@of a pushover, okay? Ha ha ha!

group_1.textLeft: Father...@Don't push yourself too hard, okay?

group_1.textRight: I won't, don't worry. Thanks, Kako.

group_1.narration: My father got help from other people in the@area to protest the new apartments someone@wanted to build after the land buyout.
He threw himself into the effort and steadily@built up more and more support...
But at the same time...@The harassment also began...

group_1.textRight: Um... this... was on the ground in front of@the store...

group_1.textLeft: They tore down one of our protest posters@again, huh?

group_1.textRight: You were...fighting with Mom again last@night, weren't you?

group_1.textLeft: You don't have to worry about anything, Kako.@Leave everything to me...!

group_1.narration: But it wasn't long until the worst@thing imaginable happened...
The moment that changed everything,@not just for the Natsume family home,@but for my own destiny fell upon us...

group_1.textRight: Dad! It's too dangerous!@Get away from there!

group_1.narration: I held my father back from the raging flames,@and all I could do was apologize silently.
There was nothing I could have done...
[textRed:...Even though I saw who started it!]
